qas.question: What countries are recognized as Nuclear Weapons States?

answers.text: China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom and the United States

qas.question: How many countries are permanent seats on the UN Security Council?
What other countries are referred to as middle powers?

answers.text: China, France, Russia and the United Kingdom

qas.question: What treaty addresses global political and economic dominance?

plausible_answers.text: China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom and the United States

qas.question: What five countries are referred to as middle powers?
Why Are China, France, Russia, the UK and the US seen as by middle powers?

plausible_answers.text: as to the current status of these powers or what precisely defines a great power

qas.question: What is there not consensus on among nations regarding powers?
What do the five nations have as middle powers on the UN Security Council?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom and the United States<b5_0/><a0_0/> are often referred to as <b6_0>great powers<b6_0/> by academics due to "their political and economic dominance of the global arena". These <a1_0>five<a1_0/> nations are the only states to have <b8_0>permanent seats with veto power<b8_0/> on the UN Security Council. They are also the only recognized "Nuclear Weapons States" under <b4_0>the <a3_0>Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty<b4_0/><a3_0/>, and maintain military expenditures which are among the largest in the world. However, there is no unanimous agreement among authorities <b7_0>as to the current status of these powers or what precisely defines a great power<b7_0/>. For example, sources have at times referred to <a2_0>China, France, Russia and the United Kingdom<a2_0/> as middle powers.
